Packets are being mailed out on March 16 and are available for download below. While these learning opportunities are not required, they highly recommended in order to keep your students engaged educationally.", "imageSrc": "/cms/lib/CA50000190/Centricity/Domain/2689/Coronavirus_FUSD.png", "imageWidth": "", "imageHeight": "", "imageAltText": "Check Updates", "isLinked": "False", "linkUrl": "https://www.fusd.net/coronavirus", "linkText": "Check For Updates", "openLinkInNewWindow": "True", "videoLinkText": "", "videoIsEmbedded": "False", "videoIframe": "" }, {}] };

span.h4: As the situation with the Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) continues to change, we will continue to add information and resources to this website. We encourage all of our families to limit the potential exposure to this threat by staying home whenever possible.
span.p: April 1, 2020
Dear Fontana Unified School District families:

The health and safety of our students, staff, and our surrounding community is a top priority for all. The evolving Novel Coronavirus COVID-19 situation continues to cause educational institutions and organizations in virtually all industries to make difficult decisions regarding their operations. We recognize that we must take appropriate measures to do our part in controlling and containing the potential spread of the virus. We continue to follow the guidance of the State of California, San Bernardino County Superintendent of Schools, and Public Health experts on how we can keep our community safe.

Yesterday evening Tony Thurmond, our California State Superintendent of Public Instruction, put out a communication urging all school districts to move towards distance learning opportunities for the remainder of the school year. Today, the Governor of California reinforced this message. Fontana Unified has developed a distance learning plan and is actively implementing this scenario to facilitate learning during this unique time.

On March 19, we announced the closing of all Fontana Unified schools through Friday, May 1, 2020, with the option of extending this closure if necessary. In alignment with the recommendations of the Governor, State Superintendent of Public Instruction, the Department of Public Health, and the San Bernardino County Superintendent of Schools, Fontana Unified schools will be closed to normal operations through the end of the traditional school year. This decision is a difficult one, but the safety of our students, staff and their families remains our main priority.

During the closure period, no matter the length, we will continue to provide students with quality learning opportunities and supports. Students and families will continue to be provided with resources, both digitally and printed. We are continuing to develop and deliver innovative avenues for students to learn and grow in the context of the current situation. You can find more information about these continually evolving opportunities for learning atwww.fusd.net/learning.

We understand that this closure has caused many of the normal classroom and school related experiences to now be transferred to the home. We also understand that our students value these experiences and we will make every effort to provide those experiences either at a later date or in a different format.

FUSD will continue to provide Grab and Go meals to those who require them at ten selected school locations throughout the District. These meals are available for all children 18 and under. For more information about this program, visit our website atwww.fusd.net/meals.

We want to remind you to continue to take simple everyday preventive actions to help prevent the spread of respiratory viruses. These include washing hands with soap and water, coughing into sleeve/tissue, staying home if sick, and practicing social distancing. If you or your child are exhibiting signs of illness such as fever, cough, sore throat, or difficulty breathing, please contact your healthcare provider.

Up-to-date information about FUSD school closures is available through our website,www.fusd.net/coronavirus. If you have any questions, you may call us at 909-357-5000 ext. 29950 or email us atcoronavirus@fusd.net.
Be safe and well.
Sincerely,

Randal S. Bassett
Superintendent of Schools

span.h4: A medida que la situacin con el Nuevo Coronavirus (COVID-19) siga cambiando, continuaremos agregando informacin y recursos a este sitio web. Animamos a todas nuestras familias a limitar la posible exposicin a esta amenaza quedndose en casa siempre que sea posible.
span.p: 1 de abril, 2020
Queridas familias del distrito unificado de Fontana,

La salud y la seguridad de nuestros estudiantes, personal y nuestra comunidad circundante es una prioridad para todos. La evolucin de la situacin de Nuevo Coronavirus COVID-19 sigue haciendo que las instituciones y organizaciones educativas de prcticamente todas las industrias tomen decisiones difciles con respecto a sus operaciones. Reconocemos que debemos tomar las medidas apropiadas para hacer nuestra parte en el control y la contencin de la posible propagacin del virus. Seguimos siguiendo la gua del Estado de California, el Superintendente de Escuelas del Condado de San Bernardino y expertos en Salud Pblica sobre cmo podemos mantener nuestra comunidad segura.

Ayer por la tarde Tony Thurmond, nuestro Superintendente de Instruccin Pblica del Estado de California, public una comunicacin instando a todos los distritos escolares a avanzar hacia oportunidades de aprendizaje a distancia por el resto del ao escolar. Hoy, el Gobernador de California reforz este mensaje. El distrito unificado de Fontana ha desarrollado un plan de aprendizaje a distancia y est implementando activamente este escenario para facilitar el aprendizaje durante este tiempo nico.

El 19 de marzo, anunciamos el cierre de todas las escuelas del distrito de Fontana hasta el viernes 1 de mayo de 2020, con la opcin de extender este cierre si fuera necesario. En consonancia con las recomendaciones del Gobernador, el Superintendente Estatal de Instruccin Pblica, el Departamento de Salud Pblica y el Superintendente de Escuelas del Condado de San Bernardino, las escuelas del distrito unificado de Fontana estarn cerradas para las operaciones normales hasta el final del ao escolar tradicional. Esta decisin es difcil, pero la seguridad de nuestros estudiantes, personal y sus familias sigue siendo nuestra prioridad principal.

Durante el perodo de cierre, sin importar la duracin, continuaremos proporcionando a los estudiantes oportunidades y apoyos de aprendizaje de calidad. Los estudiantes y las familias seguirn recibiendo recursos, tanto digitales como impresos. Continuamos desarrollando y ofreciendo vas innovadoras para que los estudiantes aprendan y crezcan en el contexto de la situacin actual. Puede encontrar ms informacin sobre estas oportunidades de aprendizaje en constante evolucin en www.fusd.net/learning.

Entendemos que este cierre ha causado que muchas de las experiencias relacionadas con el saln de clases normal y la escuela ahora se transfieran al hogar. Tambin entendemos que nuestros estudiantes valoran estas experiencias y haremos todo lo posible para proporcionar esas experiencias, ya sea en una fecha posterior o en un formato diferente.

FUSD continuar proporcionando comidas "Grab and Go" a aquellos que las requieran en diez lugares escolares seleccionados en todo el Distrito. Estas comidas estn disponibles para todos los nios menores de 18 aos. Para obtener ms informacin sobre este programa, visite nuestro sitio web en www.fusd.net/meals.

Queremos recordarle que siga tomando medidas preventivas simples todos los das para ayudar a prevenir la propagacin de los virus respiratorios. Estos incluyen lavarse las manos con agua y jabn, toser en la manga/pauelo, permanecer en casa si est enfermo y practicar el distanciamiento social. Si usted o su hijo estn presentando signos de enfermedad como fiebre, tos, dolor de garganta o dificultad para respirar, comunquese con su proveedor de atencin mdica.

La informacin actualizada sobre los cierres de escuelas FUSD est disponible a travs de nuestro sitio web, www.fusd.net/coronavirus. Si tiene alguna pregunta, puede llamarnos al 909-357-5000 ext. 29950 o enviarnos un correo electrnico a coronavirus@fusd.net.
Mantnganse seguros y bien.
Sinceramente,

Randal S. Bassett
Superintendente de Escuelas

Taking Care of Your Emotional Health
National Child Traumatic Stress Network - Guide to help families cope with Coronavirus
Talking with Children: Tips for Caregivers, Parents and Teachers during infectious disease outbreaks

Handwashing and Hand Sanitizer Use at Home, at Play and Out and About

p.span: The Governing Board desires to provide a safe school environment that allows all students equal access and opportunities in the district's academic and other educational support programs, services, and activities. The Board prohibits, at any district school or school activity, unlawful discrimination, harassment, intimidation, and bullying of any student based on the student's actual race, color, ancestry, national origin, ethnic group identification, age, religion, marital or parental status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, or gender expression; the perception of one or more of such characteristics; or association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics.[br]To report any violations of the above policy, please contact: Please visit the Complaints Procedures page for the appropriate administrator
